text: The voiced retroflex approximant is a type of consonant used in some languages. The symbol in the International Phonetic Alphabet that represents this sound is , and the equivalent X-SAMPA symbol is `r\``. The IPA symbol is a turned lowercase letter r with a rightward hook protruding from the lower right of the letter. ==Features== Features of the voiced retroflex approximant: ==Occurrence== {| class=wikitable !colspan=2| Language !!
